    7: %% you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.

    9: %%
   10: %%     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
   11: %%

   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   14: %% WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   15: %% See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   16: %% limitations under the License.
   17: %%
   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_debug_info_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Make sure that we test running code compiled using the
   23: %% `beam_debug_info` option. This will ensure that we test
   24: %% `beam_disasm` on a module with debug information.
   25: -compile([beam_debug_info]).
   26: 
   27: -include("beam_opcodes.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   33:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   34:          smoke/1,
   35:          fixed_bugs/1,
   36:          empty_module/1,
   37:          call_in_call_args/1,
   38:          missing_vars/1]).
   39: 
   40: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   41: 
   42: all() ->
   43:     [smoke,
   44:      {group,p}].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   48:       [fixed_bugs,
   49:        empty_module,
   50:        call_in_call_args,
   51:        missing_vars]}].
   52: 
   53: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   54:     id(Config),
   55:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: smoke(_Config) ->
   68:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{}),
   69: 
   70:     TestBeams0 = get_unique_beam_files(),
   71:     TestBeams = compiler_beams() ++ TestBeams0,
   72: 
   73:     S = ~"""
   74:          Below, for each module, there is a list of functions with
   75:          variables missing in the BEAM debug info. Note that there
   76:          will probably never be possible to have all variables
   77:          present in the debug info, because some variables die before
   78:          a `debug_line` instruction is reached.
   79: 
   80:          ** means that at least one of the missing variables is
   81:             significant (does not start with an underscore).
   82: 
   83:          """,
   84:     io:put_chars(S),
   85: 
   86:     test_lib:p_run(fun(Beam) ->
   87:                            do_smoke(Beam, Node)
   88:                    end, TestBeams),
   89: 
   90:     peer:stop(Peer),
   91: 
   92:     ok.
   93: 
   94: 
   95: compiler_beams() ->
   96:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler), "ebin", "*.beam"])).
   97: 
   98: do_smoke(Beam, Node) ->
   99:     try
  100: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr0}}]}} =
  101: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  102: 
  103:         %% beam_validator will check for each `debug_line` instruction
  104:         %% that the frame size is correct and that all referenced BEAM
  105:         %% registers are valid.
  106:         {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:forms(Abstr0,
  107:                                       [beam_debug_info,binary,report_errors]),
  108:         {ok,_,Abstr} = compile:forms(Abstr0,
  109:                                      [beam_debug_info,dexp,binary,report_errors]),
  110:         SrcVars = source_variables(Abstr),
  111:         IndexToFunctionMap = abstr_debug_lines(Abstr),
  112: 
  113:         %% Retrieve the debug information in two different ways.
  114:         {DebugInfo,CookedDebugInfo} = get_debug_info(Mod, Code),
  115:         DebugInfoBif = lists:sort(load_get_debug_info(Node, Mod, Code)),
  116:         CookedDebugInfoSorted = lists:sort(CookedDebugInfo),
  117: 
  118:         if
  119:             CookedDebugInfoSorted =:= DebugInfoBif ->
  120:                 ok;
  121:             true ->
  122:                 Z0 = lists:zip(CookedDebugInfoSorted, DebugInfoBif,
  123:                                {pad, {short,short}}),
  124:                 Z = lists:dropwhile(fun({A,B}) -> A =:= B end, Z0),
  125:                 io:format("~p\n", [Z]),
  126:                 io:format("~p\n", [CookedDebugInfoSorted]),
  127:                 io:format("~p\n", [DebugInfoBif]),
  128: 
  129:                 error(inconsistent_debug_info)
  130:         end,
  131: 
  132:         case Mod of
  133:             ?MODULE ->
  134:                 %% This module has been compiled with `beam_debug_info`.
  135:                 CookedDebugInfoSorted = lists:sort(code:get_debug_info(Mod));
  136:             _ ->
  137:                 ok
  138:         end,
  139: 
  140:         {DbgVars,DbgLiterals} = debug_info_vars(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap),
  141: 
  142:         %% The debug information must only contain variables that are
  143:         %% present in the source code. If the sanity check below
  144:         %% fails, it could be for one of the following reasons:
  145:         %%
  146:         %%   * A compiler pass has introduced a new temporary variable
  147:         %%     whose name is a legal Erlang variable name. (Such
  148:         %%     temporary variables are supposed to have invalid names,
  149:         %%     such as `rec1`.)
  150:         %%
  151:         %%   * Something is wrong in the mapping from `debug_line`
  152:         %%     instruction to function names, causing a variable to be
  153:         %%     collected into the wrong function. (See
  154:         %%     abstr_debug_lines/1.)
  155:         %%
  156:         %%   * A heuristic in source_variables/1 is wrong, causing variables
  157:         %%     that actually are present in the debug information to be
  158:         %%     removed from the list of variables from the source code.
  159: 
  160:         [] = family_difference(DbgVars, SrcVars),
  161: 
  162:         %% Now figure out which variables are missing from the debug info
  163:         %% and print them.
  164:         AllDbg = family_union(DbgVars, DbgLiterals),
  165:         Diff0 = family_difference(SrcVars, AllDbg),
  166:         Diff = [begin
  167:                     {Vars,B} = format_vars(Vars0),
  168:                     S = io_lib:format("~p/~p: ~ts", [F,A,Vars]),
  169:                     ["  ",case B of
  170:                               true -> "   " ++ S;
  171:                               false -> "** " ++ S
  172:                           end,"\n"]
  173:                 end || {{F,A},Vars0} <:- Diff0],
  174:         io:format("~p:\n~ts", [Mod,Diff])
  175:     catch
  176: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
  177: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
  178: 		      [Error,Beam]),
  179: 	    error;
  180: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
  181: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
  182: 	    error
  183:     end.
  184: 
  185: format_vars(Vs) ->
  186:     Str = lists:join(", ", [io_lib:format("~ts", [V]) || V <- Vs]),
  187:     B = lists:all(fun(V) ->
  188:                           case atom_to_binary(V) of
  189:                               <<"_",_/binary>> -> true;
  190:                               _ -> false
  191:                           end
  192:                   end, Vs),
  193:     {Str,B}.
  194: 
  195: debug_info_vars(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap) ->
  196:     {Vars0,Literals0} = debug_info_vars_1(DebugInfo, IndexToFunctionMap, [], []),
  197:     Vars = family_union(Vars0),
  198:     Literals = family_union(Literals0),
  199:     {Vars,Literals}.
  200: 
  201: debug_info_vars_1([{I,{_FrameSize,List}}|T], IndexToFunctionMap, VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  202:     case debug_info_vars_2(List, [], []) of
  203:         {[],[]} ->
  204:             debug_info_vars_1(T, IndexToFunctionMap, VarAcc, LitAcc);
  205:         {Vars,Literals} ->
  206:             F = map_get(I, IndexToFunctionMap),
  207:             debug_info_vars_1(T, IndexToFunctionMap,
  208:                               [{F,Vars}|VarAcc], [{F,Literals}|LitAcc])
  209:     end;
  210: debug_info_vars_1([], _, VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  211:     {VarAcc,LitAcc}.
  212: 
  213: debug_info_vars_2([{Name,_Value}|T], VarAcc, LitAcc) when is_integer(Name) ->
  214:     debug_info_vars_2(T, VarAcc, LitAcc);
  215: debug_info_vars_2([{Name0,Value}|T], VarAcc, LitAcc) when is_binary(Name0) ->
  216:     Name = binary_to_atom(Name0),
  217:     case Value of
  218:         {x,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, [Name|VarAcc], LitAcc);
  219:         {y,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, [Name|VarAcc], LitAcc);
  220:         {value,_} -> debug_info_vars_2(T, VarAcc, [Name|LitAcc])
  221:     end;
  222: debug_info_vars_2([], VarAcc, LitAcc) ->
  223:     {VarAcc,LitAcc}.
  224: 
  225: family_union(S0) ->
  226:     S1 = sofs:relation(S0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  227:     S2 = sofs:relation_to_family(S1),
  228:     S3 = sofs:family_union(S2),
  229:     sofs:to_external(S3).
  230: 
  231: family_union(F0, F1) ->
  232:     S0 = sofs:relation(F0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  233:     S1 = sofs:relation(F1, [{function,[variable]}]),
  234:     S2 = sofs:family_union(S0, S1),
  235:     sofs:to_external(S2).
  236: 
  237: family_difference(F0, F1) ->
  238:     S0 = sofs:family(F0, [{function,[variable]}]),
  239:     S1 = sofs:family(F1, [{function,[variable]}]),
  240:     S2 = sofs:family_difference(S0, S1),
  241:     SpecFun = fun(S) -> sofs:no_elements(S) =/= 0 end,
  242:     S3 = sofs:family_specification(SpecFun, S2),
  243:     sofs:to_external(S3).
  244: 
  245: %% Load a module on a remote node and retrieve debug information.
  246: load_get_debug_info(Node, Mod, Beam) ->
  247:     erpc:call(Node,
  248:               fun() ->
  249:                       {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
  250:                       DebugInfo = code:get_debug_info(Mod),
  251: 
  252:                       case Mod of
  253:                           ?MODULE ->
  254:                               %% Don't purge the module that this fun
  255:                               %% is located in.
  256:                               ok;
  257:                           _ ->
  258:                               %% Smoke test of purging a module with
  259:                               %% debug information.
  260:                               _ = code:delete(Mod),
  261:                               _ = code:purge(Mod)
  262:                       end,
  263:                       DebugInfo
  264:               end).
  265: 
  266: %%
  267: %% Extract variables mentioned in the source code. Try to remove
  268: %% variables that will never show up in the debug information; for
  269: %% examples, definitions of variables that are not followed by any
  270: %% `debug_line` instructions can be ignored.
  271: %%
  272: source_variables(Abstr) ->
  273:     [{{Name,Arity},extract_src_vars(F)} ||
  274:         {function,_,Name,Arity,_}=F <- Abstr].
  275: 
  276: extract_src_vars(F) ->
  277:     L1 = extract_src_vars(F, true, #{}),
  278:     L2 = [V || V := true <- L1],
  279:     lists:sort(L2).
  280: 
  281: extract_src_vars({var,_,'_'}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  282:     Acc;
  283: extract_src_vars({var,_,Name}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  284:     case atom_to_binary(Name) of
  285:         <<"cov",_/binary>> ->
  286:             %% Ignore variable added by the sys_coverage pass.
  287:             Acc0;
  288:         <<"rec",_/binary>> ->
  289:             %% Ignore variable added by the erl_expand_pass.
  290:             Acc0;
  291:         _ ->
  292:             true = beam_ssa_codegen:is_original_variable(Name),
  293:             Acc0#{Name => true}
  294:     end;
  295: extract_src_vars({atom,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  296: extract_src_vars({bin,_,Es}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  297:     extract_args(Es, Acc);
  298: extract_src_vars({bin_element,_,Val,Size,_}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  299:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Val, false, Acc0),
  300:     case Size of
  301:         default -> Acc1;
  302:         _ -> extract_src_vars(Size, false, Acc1)
  303:     end;
  304: extract_src_vars({char,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  305: extract_src_vars({float,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  306: extract_src_vars({integer,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  307: extract_src_vars({nil,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  308: extract_src_vars({string,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) -> Acc;
  309: extract_src_vars({cons,_,Hd,Tl}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  310:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Hd, Lc, Acc0),
  311:     extract_src_vars(Tl, Lc, Acc1);
  312: extract_src_vars({map,_,Fs}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  313:     extract_args(Fs, Acc0);
  314: extract_src_vars({map,_,M,Fs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  315:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(M, Lc, Acc0),
  316:     extract_args(Fs, Acc1);
  317: extract_src_vars({map_field_assoc,_,K,V}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  318:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(K, false, Acc0),
  319:     extract_src_vars(V, false, Acc1);
  320: extract_src_vars({map_field_exact,_,K,V}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  321:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(K, false, Acc0),
  322:     extract_src_vars(V, false, Acc1);
  323: extract_src_vars({tuple,_,Es}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  324:     extract_args(Es, Acc);
  325: extract_src_vars({call,_,F,As}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  326:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(F, Lc, Acc0),
  327:     extract_args(As, Acc1);
  328: extract_src_vars({remote,_,Mod,Name}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  329:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Mod, Lc, Acc0),
  330:     extract_src_vars(Name, Lc, Acc1);
  331: extract_src_vars({match,_,P,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  332:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  333:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc1);
  334: extract_src_vars({op,_,_Name,Arg}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  335:     extract_src_vars(Arg, Lc, Acc0);
  336: extract_src_vars({op,_,_Name,Lhs,Rhs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  337:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Lhs, false, Acc0),
  338:     extract_src_vars(Rhs, Lc, Acc1);
  339: extract_src_vars({debug_line,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  340:     Acc;
  341: extract_src_vars({executable_line,_,_}, _Lc, Acc) ->
  342:     Acc;
  343: extract_src_vars({named_fun,_,Name,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  344:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  345:         false ->
  346:             %% Since there are no `debug_line` instructions within this fun,
  347:             %% none of the variables defined in the fun should ever
  348:             %% show up in the debug info.
  349:             Acc0;
  350:         true when Name =/= '_' ->
  351:             Acc = case Name of
  352:                       '_' -> Acc0;
  353:                       _ -> extract_src_vars({var,anno,Name}, Lc, Acc0)
  354:                   end,
  355:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc)
  356:     end;
  357: extract_src_vars({function,_Anno,_,_,Cs}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  358:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  359:         true ->
  360:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc0);
  361:         false ->
  362:             %% There are no `debug_line` instructions in this
  363:             %% function. This happens if code has been placed in a
  364:             %% header filer, or if the `-file()` attribute has been
  365:             %% used to change the name of the source file.
  366:             Acc0
  367:     end;
  368: extract_src_vars({'fun',_Anno,{clauses,Cs}}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  369:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Cs) of
  370:         true ->
  371:             extract_cs(Cs, true, Acc0);
  372:         false ->
  373:             Acc0
  374:     end;
  375: extract_src_vars({'fun',_Anno,_}, _Lc, Acc0) -> Acc0;
  376: extract_src_vars({block,_Anno,Es}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  377:     extract_body(Es, Lc, Acc0);
  378: extract_src_vars({'receive',_Anno,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  379:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  380: extract_src_vars({'receive',_Anno,Cs,_To,ToE}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  381:     Acc1 = extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0),
  382:     extract_body(ToE, Lc, Acc1);
  383: extract_src_vars({'maybe',_Anno,Body}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  384:     extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc0);
  385: extract_src_vars({'maybe',_Anno,Body,{'else',_,ElseClauses}}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  386:     Acc1 = extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc0),
  387:     extract_cs(ElseClauses, Lc, Acc1);
  388: extract_src_vars({'maybe_match',_Anno,P,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  389:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  390:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc1);
  391: extract_src_vars({'case',_Anno,E,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  392:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(E, false, Acc0),
  393:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc1);
  394: extract_src_vars({'if',_Anno,Cs}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  395:     extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  396: extract_src_vars({'try',_Anno,Es,Scs,Ccs,As}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  397:     Acc1 = extract_body(Es, false, Acc0),
  398:     Acc2 = extract_cs(Scs, Lc, Acc1),
  399:     Acc3 = extract_cs(Ccs, Lc, Acc2),
  400:     extract_body(As, Lc, Acc3);
  401: extract_src_vars({'catch',_Anno,E}, Lc, Acc0) ->
  402:     extract_src_vars(E, Lc, Acc0);
  403: extract_src_vars({zip,_,Qs0}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  404:     Qs = extract_sv_qs(Qs0),
  405:     extract_args(Qs, Acc0);
  406: extract_src_vars({C,_,Build,Qs0}, Lc, Acc0)
  407:   when C =:= lc; C =:= bc; C =:= mc ->
  408:     case any_debug_line_instrs(Build) of
  409:         false ->
  410:             Qs = extract_sv_qs(Qs0),
  411:             case any_debug_line_instrs(Qs) of
  412:                 false ->
  413:                     Acc0;
  414:                 true ->
  415:                     extract_args(Qs, Acc0)
  416:             end;
  417:         true ->
  418:             Acc1 = extract_src_vars(Build, Lc, Acc0),
  419:             extract_args(Qs0, Acc1)
  420:     end;
  421: extract_src_vars({G,_,P,E}, _Lc, Acc0) ->
  422:     true = is_generator(G),                     %Assertion.
  423:     Acc1 = extract_src_vars(P, false, Acc0),
  424:     extract_src_vars(E, false, Acc1).
  425: 
  426: is_generator(generate) -> true;
  427: is_generator(b_generate) -> true;
  428: is_generator(m_generate) -> true;
  429: is_generator(generate_strict) -> true;
  430: is_generator(b_generate_strict) -> true;
  431: is_generator(m_generate_strict) -> true;
  432: is_generator(_) -> false.
  433: 
  434: extract_cs([{clause,_,Pats,Gs,Body}|Cs], Lc, Acc0) ->
  435:     case Lc andalso not any_debug_line_instrs(Body)  of
  436:         true ->
  437:             extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc0);
  438:         false ->
  439:             Acc1 = extract_args(Pats, Acc0),
  440:             Acc2 = extract_guards(Gs, Acc1),
  441:             Acc3 = extract_body(Body, Lc, Acc2),
  442:             extract_cs(Cs, Lc, Acc3)
  443:     end;
  444: extract_cs([], _, Acc) ->
  445:     Acc.
  446: 
  447: extract_body([I], Lc, Acc) ->
  448:     case Lc andalso not any_debug_line_instrs(I) of
  449:         true ->
  450:             Acc;
  451:         false ->
  452:             extract_src_vars(I, Lc, Acc)
  453:     end;
  454: extract_body([I|Is], Lc, Acc0) ->
  455:     Acc = extract_src_vars(I, false, Acc0),
  456:     extract_body(Is, Lc, Acc);
  457: extract_body([], _Lc, Acc) -> Acc.
  458: 
  459: extract_args([A|As], Acc) ->
  460:     extract_args(As, extract_src_vars(A, false, Acc));
  461: extract_args([], Acc) -> Acc.
  462: 
  463: extract_guards([A|As], Acc) ->
  464:     extract_guards(As, extract_args(A, Acc));
  465: extract_guards([], Acc) -> Acc.
  466: 
  467: extract_sv_qs([{block,BlkL,[{executable_line,_,_}|Bs]}|Qs1]) ->
  468:     %% Note: `debug_line` instructions are `executable_line`
  469:     %% instructions in the abstract code.
  470:     [{block,BlkL,Bs}|extract_sv_qs_1(Qs1)];
  471: extract_sv_qs(Qs) -> Qs.
  472: 
  473: extract_sv_qs_1([Q|Qs]) ->
  474:     case abstr_extract_debug_lines(Qs, []) of
  475:         [] ->
  476:             [Q];
  477:         [_|_] ->
  478:             [Q|extract_sv_qs_1(Qs)]
  479:     end;
  480: extract_sv_qs_1([]) -> [].
  481: 
  482: any_debug_line_instrs(Abstr) ->
  483:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr, []) =/= [].
  484: 
  485: %%
  486: %% Return a mapping from `debug_line` instruction index to function.
  487: %%
  488: abstr_debug_lines(Abstr) ->
  489:     S0 = [{{Name,Arity},abstr_extract_debug_lines(Body)} ||
  490:              {function,_,Name,Arity,Body} <- Abstr],
  491:     S1 = sofs:family(S0, [{function,[line]}]),
  492:     S2 = sofs:family_to_relation(S1),
  493:     S3 = sofs:converse(S2),
  494:     S4 = sofs:to_external(S3),
  495:     maps:from_list(S4).
  496: 
  497: abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr) ->
  498:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(Abstr, []).
  499: 
  500: abstr_extract_debug_lines({debug_line,_,Index}, Acc) ->
  501:     [Index|Acc];
  502: abstr_extract_debug_lines([H|T], Acc0) ->
  503:     Acc1 = abstr_extract_debug_lines(H, Acc0),
  504:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(T, Acc1);
  505: abstr_extract_debug_lines(Tuple, Acc0) when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  506:     abstr_extract_debug_lines(tuple_to_list(Tuple), Acc0);
  507: abstr_extract_debug_lines(_, Acc) -> Acc.
  508: 
  509: %%%
  510: %%% Read and disassemble the BEAM debug information from the "DbgB"
  511: %%% chunk of a BEAM file.
  512: %%%
  513: get_debug_info(Mod, Beam) ->
  514:     {ok,{Mod,[{"DbgB",DebugInfo0},
  515:               {atoms,Atoms0},
  516:               {"Line",Lines0}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["DbgB",atoms,"Line"]),
  517:     Atoms = maps:from_list(Atoms0),
  518:     Literals = case beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["LitT"]) of
  519:                    {ok,{Mod,[{"LitT",Literals0}]}} ->
  520:                        decode_literal_table(Literals0);
  521:                    {error,_,_} ->
  522:                        []
  523:                end,
  524:     Op = beam_opcodes:opcode(call, 2),
  525:     <<Version:32,
  526:       _NumItems:32,
  527:       _NumVars:32,
  528:       DebugInfo1/binary>> = DebugInfo0,
  529:     0 = Version,
  530:     RawDebugInfo0 = decode_debug_info(DebugInfo1, Literals, Atoms, Op),
  531:     RawDebugInfo = lists:zip(lists:seq(1, length(RawDebugInfo0)), RawDebugInfo0),
  532: 
  533:     %% The cooked debug info has line numbers instead of indices.
  534:     Lines = decode_line_table(Lines0, Literals, Atoms),
  535:     {beam_file,Mod,_Exp,_Attr,_Opts,Fs} = beam_disasm:file(Beam),
  536:     DebugMap = #{Index => LocationIndex ||
  537:                    {function,_Name,_Arity,_Entry,Is} <:- Fs,
  538:                    {debug_line,LocationIndex,Index,_Live} <- Is},
  539:     CookedDebugInfo =
  540:         [{map_get(map_get(Index, DebugMap), Lines),Info} ||
  541:             {Index,Info} <:- RawDebugInfo,
  542:             is_map_key(Index, DebugMap)],
  543: 
  544:     {RawDebugInfo,CookedDebugInfo}.
  545: 
  546: decode_line_table(<<0:32,_Bits:32,_NumIs:32,NumLines:32,
  547:                     _NumFnames:32, Lines0/binary>>,
  548:                   Literals, Atoms) ->
  549:     Lines = decode_line_tab_1(Lines0, Literals, Atoms, NumLines),
  550:     #{K => V || {K,V} <:- lists:zip(lists:seq(1, length(Lines)), Lines)}.
  551: 
  552: decode_line_tab_1(_Lines, _Literals, _Atoms, 0) ->
  553:     [];
  554: decode_line_tab_1(Lines0, Literals, Atoms, N) ->
  555:     case decode_arg(Lines0, Literals, Atoms) of
  556:         {{atom,_},Lines1} ->
  557:             decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N);
  558:         {{integer,Line},Lines1} ->
  559:             [Line|decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N - 1)];
  560:         {nil,Lines1} ->
  561:             decode_line_tab_1(Lines1, Literals, Atoms, N)
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564: decode_literal_table(<<0:32,N:32,Tab/binary>>) ->
  565:     #{Index => binary_to_term(Literal) ||
  566:         Index <- lists:seq(0, N - 1) &&
  567:             <<Size:32,Literal:Size/binary>> <:= Tab}.
  568: 
  569: decode_debug_info(Code0, Literals, Atoms, Op) ->
  570:     case Code0 of
  571:         <<Op,Code1/binary>> ->
  572:             {FrameSize0,Code2} = decode_arg(Code1, Literals, Atoms),
  573:             FrameSize = case FrameSize0 of
  574:                             nil -> none;
  575:                             {atom,entry} -> entry;
  576:                             _ -> FrameSize0
  577:                         end,
  578:             {{list,List0},Code3} = decode_arg(Code2, Literals, Atoms),
  579:             List = decode_list(List0),
  580:             [{FrameSize,List}|decode_debug_info(Code3, Literals, Atoms, Op)];
  581:         <<>> ->
  582:             []
  583:     end.
  584: 
  585: decode_list([{integer,Var}|T]) when is_integer(Var) ->
  586:     decode_list([{literal,Var}|T]);
  587: decode_list([{literal,Var},Where0|T]) ->
  588:     Where = case Where0 of
  589:                 {literal,Lit} -> {value,Lit};
  590:                 {atom,A} -> {value,A};
  591:                 {integer,I} -> {value,I};
  592:                 nil -> {value,[]};
  593:                 {x,_} -> Where0;
  594:                 {y,_} -> Where0
  595:             end,
  596:     [{Var,Where}|decode_list(T)];
  597: decode_list([]) -> [].
  598: 
  599: decode_args(0, Code, _Literals, _Atoms) ->
  600:     {[],Code};
  601: decode_args(N, Code0, Literals, Atoms) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
  602:     {Arg,Code1} = decode_arg(Code0, Literals, Atoms),
  603:     {Args,Code2} = decode_args(N - 1, Code1, Literals, Atoms),
  604:     {[Arg|Args],Code2}.
  605: 
  606: decode_arg(Code0, Literals, Atoms) ->
  607:     case decode_raw_arg(Code0) of
  608:         {nil,_}=Res -> Res;
  609:         {{u,N},Code1} ->
  610:             {N,Code1};
  611:         {{atom,Index},Code1} ->
  612:             {{atom,map_get(Index, Atoms)},Code1};
  613:         {{integer,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  614:         {{x,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  615:         {{y,_},_}=Res -> Res;
  616:         {{z,1},Code1} ->
  617:             {{u,N},Code2} = decode_raw_arg(Code1),
  618:             {List,Code3} = decode_args(N, Code2, Literals, Atoms),
  619:             {{list,List},Code3};
  620:         {{z,4},Code1} ->
  621:             {{u,N},Code2} = decode_raw_arg(Code1),
  622:             {{literal,map_get(N, Literals)},Code2}
  623:     end.
  624: 
  625: decode_raw_arg(<<0:4,0:1,?tag_a:3,Code/binary>>) ->
  626:     {nil,Code};
  627: decode_raw_arg(<<N:4,0:1,Tag:3,Code/binary>>) ->
  628:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code};
  629: decode_raw_arg(<<2#111:3,1:1,1:1,Tag:3,Code0/binary>>) ->
  630:     {{u,W0},Code1} = decode_raw_arg(Code0),
  631:     W = W0 + 9,
  632:     <<N:W/signed-unit:8,Code2/binary>> = Code1,
  633:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code2};
  634: decode_raw_arg(<<W0:3,1:1,1:1,Tag:3,Code0/binary>>) ->
  635:     W = W0 + 2,
  636:     <<N:W/signed-unit:8,Code1/binary>> = Code0,
  637:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code1};
  638: decode_raw_arg(<<High:3,0:1,1:1,Tag:3,Low,Code0/binary>>) ->
  639:     N = (High bsl 8) bor Low,
  640:     {{decode_tag(Tag),N},Code0}.
  641: 
  642: decode_tag(?tag_u) -> u;
  643: decode_tag(?tag_i) -> integer;
  644: decode_tag(?tag_a) -> atom;
  645: decode_tag(?tag_x) -> x;
  646: decode_tag(?tag_y) -> y;
  647: decode_tag(?tag_z) -> z.
  648: 
  649: %%%
  650: %%% Other test cases.
  651: %%%
  652: 
  653: fixed_bugs(_Config) ->
  654:     ok = unassigned_yreg(ok),
  655:     {'EXIT',_} = catch unassigned_yreg(not_ok),
  656: 
  657:     ~"xyz" = wrong_frame_size(id(~"xyz")),
  658:     boom = catch wrong_frame_size(id(42)),
  659: 
  660:     {ok,error} = no_function(ok),
  661: 
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: unassigned_yreg(V) ->
  665:     case id(V) of
  666:         _ ->
  667:             case V of ok -> ok end,
  668:             case catch id(whatever) of
  669:                 Y ->
  670:                     case id(true) of
  671:                         true ->
  672:                             id(Y),
  673:                             ok;
  674:                         false ->
  675:                             ok
  676:                     end
  677:             end
  678:     end.
  679: 
  680: wrong_frame_size(X) ->
  681:     id(X),
  682:     case id(X) of
  683:         Y when is_binary(Y) -> Y;
  684:         _Err -> throw(boom)
  685:     end.
  686: 
  687: no_function(X) ->
  688:     case catch id(X) of
  689:         ok ->
  690:             case catch id(error) of
  691:                 Err ->
  692:                     id(0),
  693:                     id({X, Err})
  694:             end;
  695:         Err ->
  696:             id(0),
  697:             id({X, Err})
  698:     end.
  699: 
  700: 
  701: empty_module(_Config) ->
  702:     Mod = list_to_atom(?MODULE_STRING ++ "_" ++
  703:                            atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
  704:     Empty = [{attribute,{1,1},file,{atom_to_list(Mod),1}},
  705:              {attribute,{1,2},module,Mod},
  706:              {eof,{3,1}}],
  707:     {ok,Mod,_Code} = compile:forms(Empty, [beam_debug_info,report]),
  708: 
  709:     ok.
  710: 
  711: call_in_call_args(Config) ->
  712:     M = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  713:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  714:     SrcName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl"),
  715: 
  716:     S = ~"""
  717:          -module(call_in_call_args).
  718:          -export([f/1]).
  719: 
  720:          f(X) ->
  721:              bar:g(
  722:                bar:h(X),
  723:                id(X)
  724:               ).
  725:          id(I) -> I.
  726:          """,
  727: 
  728:     ok = file:write_file(SrcName, S),
  729:     {ok,M,Asm} = compile:file(SrcName, [report,beam_debug_info,binary,to_asm]),
  730:     {M,_,_,[{function,f,1,_,Is}|_],_} = Asm,
  731:     DebugLines = [I || I <- Is, element(1, I) =:= debug_line],
  732:     io:format("~p\n", [DebugLines]),
  733:     4 = length(DebugLines),
  734: 
  735:     ok.
  736: 
  737: missing_vars(Config) ->
  738:     M = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  739:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  740:     SrcName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl"),
  741: 
  742:     S = ~"""
  743:          -module(missing_vars).              %%L01
  744:          -export([f/3]).                     %%L02
  745:          f(X, Y, Z0) ->                      %%L03
  746:              case X of                       %%L04
  747:                  false ->                    %%L05
  748:                      Z1 = Z0#{k := Y},       %%L06
  749:                      foo:go(X),              %%L07
  750:                      Z1;                     %%L08
  751:                  _ ->                        %%L09
  752:                      Z1 = Z0#{k := X},       %%L10
  753:                      Z1                      %%L11
  754:              end.                            %%L12
  755:          """,
  756: 
  757:     ok = file:write_file(SrcName, S),
  758:     {ok,M,Asm} = compile:file(SrcName, [report,beam_debug_info,binary,to_asm]),
  759:     {M,_,_,[{function,f,3,_,Is}|_],_} = Asm,
  760:     DebugLines0 = [begin
  761:                        {location,_File,Line} = lists:keyfind(location, 1, Anno),
  762:                        {Line,FrameSz,[Name || {Name,_} <- Vars]}
  763:                    end || {debug_line,Anno,_,_,{FrameSz,Vars}} <- Is],
  764:     DebugLines = lists:sort(DebugLines0),
  765:     io:format("~p\n", [DebugLines]),
  766:     Expected = [{3,entry,[{integer,1},{integer,2},{integer,3}]},
  767:                 {4,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  768:                 {6,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  769:                 {7,none,['X','Z0','Z1']},
  770:                 {8,1,['Z1']},
  771:                 {10,none,['X','Y','Z0']},
  772:                 {11,none,['Y','Z0','Z1']}],
  773: 
  774:     ?assertEqual(Expected, DebugLines),
  775: 
  776:     ok.
  777: 
  778: 
  779: %%%
  780: %%% Common utility functions.
  781: %%%
  782: 
  783: get_unique_beam_files() ->
  784:     F = fun IsCloned(ModString) ->
  785:                 case ModString of
  786:                     "_dialyzer_SUITE" -> true;
  787:                     "_r25_SUITE" -> true;
  788:                     [_|T] -> IsCloned(T);
  789:                     _ -> false
  790:                 end
  791:         end,
  792:     test_lib:get_unique_files(".beam", F).
  793: 
  794: id(I) -> I.
